Entries.12{{YearRemainder}}: Between you and I, @, I'm not sure we would have a movie theater in town at all if the building didn't just show up one day.#$b#Even as is I'm not sure how they turn a profit.

Entries.8{{YearRemainder}}: Between you and I, @, I'm so glad a no pill mill has decided to set up shop here.
Entries.10{{YearRemainder}}: Before I moved here? I was an accountant at an auditing firm.

Entries.10_2: It's important to me for this town to be economically diverse. I don't want to rely on a single industry, like the way we used to rely on those mines.
Entries.12_2: Tourism could be a nice way to make money. We've got good hiking trails nearby.
Entries.14_2: @, have you ever considered holding apple picking sessions on your farm? They're more lucrative than I expected!$h
Entries.16_2: We used to be a major flower exporter. Our climate is excellent for them.$h
Entries.17_2: I read that the best grapes for wine are always kept a little stressed.

Entries.12_2: Ugh, the stock market is going insane right now, I have to keep myself from looking too much at my portfolio.#$b#I try to remind myself that buying and holding is the best strategy, but it's hard sometimes.
Entries.15_2: We're actually in a great location for hydro power. Maybe I can convince a hydro plant to come out here?
Entries.16_2: It's surprisingly hard to get a grant to get things repaired.#$b#Politicians like new shiny things with their names on it, upkeep isn't as...popular.$s
Entries.17_2: Maybe we should pivot our economy to focus more on tourism?

Entries.12_2: I've never been married. My first priority has been this town for a very long time.
